page.title: 10SWALLOW TILES
page.content: Tiles and bricks have been made in the Cranleigh area since Roman times. Swallow's Tiles was started in 1855 by the grandfather of the two present directors.The materials come from their own clay pit. First they put the sode on the bench and cut it up with a wire,then the clay is put in the mould which makes the tile shape.You smooth the tile with a strike,turn the tile out onto a board and when you have twenty tiles on the board you put them in a line to dry.Then you put them in a checker. The tiles go over all of England. Every week 2000 tiles are made.They are sand face tiles, ridge, hip, valleys, angles, hanging tiles, gables, and eves. There are 28 people working there now.
